py_sim.plotting.plot_constructor module¶

plot_constructor.py: Constructs the plot manifest for general simulation and for RRT plotting

class py_sim.plotting.plot_constructor.RRTPlotter(world: PolygonWorld, plot_iterations: int, pause_plotting: bool)¶

Bases: object

Stores data needed for plotting rrt plans

world¶

The polygon world in which the plotting occurs

Type:

PolygonWorld

plot_iterations¶

Every plot_iterations, the planner will be plotted

Type:

int

pause_plotting¶

If True, each step is paused until the user enters a key

Type:

bool

fig¶

Figure on which the plotting occurs. Initialized in first call to “plot_plan”

Type:

Optional[Figure]

plot_plan(iteration: int, tree: DirectedPathGraph, x_start: TwoDimArray, X: StateSpace, X_t: StateSpace, x_rand: TwoDimArray, x_new: TwoDimArray, ind_p: int, ind_goal: int = -1, ind_near: list[int] | None = None, ind_rewire: list[int] | None = None, sampling_ellipses: list[py_sim.tools.sim_types.EllipseParameters] | None = None, force_plot: bool = False) → None¶

Plots the rrt plan segment

Parameters:

  • iteration – The iteration number of the planner

  • tree – Underlying tree for the plan

  • x_start – the start location of the plan

  • X_t – target set

  • X – state space

  • x_rand – The newly sampled point

  • x_new – The point that the planner is attempting to add to the tree

  • ind_p – The parent index within tree to which x_new it being added

  • ind_goal – The index to the lowest cost goal location within the tree

  • ind_near – The set of nearest neighbors over which the search is performed

  • ind_rewire – The set of nodes that were rewired through x_new

  • sampling_ellipses – List of all ellipses used for sampling

  • force_plot – True => the plot will be plotted regardless of iteration

py_sim.plotting.plot_constructor.create_plot_manifest(initial_state: LocationStateType, y_limits: tuple[float, float], x_limits: tuple[float, float], position_dot: bool = False, position_triangle: bool = False, state_trajectory: bool = False, time_series: bool = False, color: tuple[float, float, float, float] = (0.2, 0.36, 0.78, 1.0), vectorfield: VectorField | None = None, vector_res: float = 0.25, world: PolygonWorld | None = None, grid: BinaryOccupancyGrid | None = None, plot_occupancy_grid: bool = False, plot_occupancy_cells: bool = False, plot_occupancy_circles: bool = False, range_bearing_locations: bool = False, range_bearing_lines: bool = False, planner: ForwardGridSearch | None = None, graph: PathGraph[GraphType] | None = None, graph_node_size: int = 10, plan: tuple[list[float], list[float]] | None = None, plan_color: tuple[float, float, float, float] = (1.0, 0.0, 1.0, 1.0), line_carrot: LineCarrot | None = None) → PlotManifest[LocationStateType]¶

Creates a plot manifest given the following inputs

Parameters:

  • y_limits – min and max y-values to plot

  • x_limits – min and max x-values to plot

  • position_dot – Plot the vehicle position as a circle

  • position_triangle – Plot the vehicle position as a triangle

  • state_trajectory – Plot the trajectory that the vehicle travelled

  • time_series – Plot the time series state

  • color – Color of the state plots

  • vectorfield – The vectorfield class to be plotted

  • vector_res – The grid resolution of the vectorfield

  • world – Polygon world in operation

  • grid – Occupancy grid to be used for plotting,

  • plot_occupancy_grid – True -> a grid will be plotted displaying occupancy, (fairly fast and very accurate)

  • plot_occupancy_cells – True -> a square for each occupied cell will be plotted (slow, but accurate),

  • plot_occupancy_circles – True -> a circle will be plotted in each occupied cell (fast, but approximate),

  • range_bearing_locations – plot the range measurement locations

  • range_bearing_lines – plot the lines for the range bearing measurements

  • planner – plots the occupancy grid, visited nodes, and planned path of the grid planner

  • graph – plots the graph of possible paths

  • graph_node_size – The size of the node circle in the graph plot

  • plan – A fixed plan to plot

  • plan_color – the color of the plan being plotted

Returns:

A plot manifest used for simulation plotting

Return type:

PlotManifest[StateType]

py_sim.plotting.plot_constructor.plot_rrt(pause_plotting: bool, world: PolygonWorld, tree: DirectedPathGraph, x_start: TwoDimArray, X: StateSpace, X_t: StateSpace, x_rand: TwoDimArray, x_new: TwoDimArray, ind_p: int, ind_goal: int = -1, ind_near: list[int] | None = None, ind_rewire: list[int] | None = None, sampling_ellipses: list[py_sim.tools.sim_types.EllipseParameters] | None = None, fig: Figure | None = None) → Figure¶

Plots the rrt data

Parameters:

  • pause_plotting – If True, each step is paused until the user enters a key

  • world – The polygon world in which the plotting occurs

  • tree – Underlying tree for the plan

  • x_start – the start location of the plan

  • X – state space

  • X_t – target set

  • x_rand – The newly sampled point

  • x_new – The point that the planner is attempting to add to the tree

  • ind_p – The parent index within tree to which x_new it being added

  • ind_goal – The index to the lowest cost goal location within the tree

  • ind_near – The set of nearest neighbors over which the search is performed

  • ind_rewire – The set of nodes that were rewired through x_new

  • sampling_ellipses – List of all ellipses used for sampling

  • fig – the figure on which to make the plots

Returns:

The figure on which the data is plotted

Return type:

Figure
